Approvals.Approvals:: (a) Approvals. Type A medicated articles: 25 percent to No. 016592 in § 510.600(c) of this chapter for use as in paragraph (d) of this section.

Special Considerations.Special Considerations:: (b) Special considerations. Do not use in Type B or Type C medicated feeds containing bentonite.

Related Tolerances.Related Tolerances:: (c) Related tolerances. See § 556.50 of this chapter.

Conditions of Use.Conditions of Use:: (d) Conditions of use—(1) Cattle. It is used as follows:

Medication in grams per ton.Medication in grams per ton: (i) 113.5 to 11, 350; to provide 5 milligrams per kilogram of body weight per day

Indications for use.Indications for use: Calves: As an aid in the prevention of coccidiosis caused by Eimeria bovis and E. zuernii
Calves: As an aid in the prevention of coccidiosis caused by Eimeria bovis and E. zuernii

Limitations.Limitations: Top-dress on or mix in the daily ration. Feed for 21 days when experience indicates that coccidiosis is likely to be a hazard, as the sole source of amprolium. Withdraw 24 hours before slaughter. A withdrawal period has not been established for this product in preruminating calves. Do not use in calves to be processed for veal

Indications for use.Indications for use: Calves: As an aid in the prevention of coccidiosis caused by Eimeria bovis and E. zuernii

Limitations.Limitations: Top-dress on or mix in the daily ration. Feed for 21 days when experience indicates that coccidiosis is likely to be a hazard, as the sole source of amprolium. Withdraw 24 hours before slaughter. A withdrawal period has not been established for this product in preruminating calves. Do not use in calves to be processed for veal

Medication in grams per ton.Medication in grams per ton: (ii) 113.5 to 11, 350; to provide 10 milligrams per kilogram of body weight per day

Indications for use.Indications for use: Calves: As an aid in the treatment of coccidiosis caused by Eimeria bovis and E. zuernii
Calves: As an aid in the treatment of coccidiosis caused by Eimeria bovis and E. zuernii

Limitations.Limitations: Top-dress on or mix in the daily ration. Feed for 5 days as the sole source of amprolium. Withdraw 24 hours before slaughter. A withdrawal period has not been established for this product in preruminating calves. Do not use in calves to be processed for veal

Indications for use.Indications for use: Calves: As an aid in the treatment of coccidiosis caused by Eimeria bovis and E. zuernii

Limitations.Limitations: Top-dress on or mix in the daily ration. Feed for 5 days as the sole source of amprolium. Withdraw 24 hours before slaughter. A withdrawal period has not been established for this product in preruminating calves. Do not use in calves to be processed for veal

Conditions of Use.Conditions of Use:: (d) (3) Turkeys. It is used as follows:

Indications for use.Indications for use: Growing turkeys: For prevention of coccidiosis; and for increased rate of weight gain and improved feed efficiency

Limitations.Limitations: Feed continuously as the sole source of amprolium; bambermycins as provided by No. 016592 in § 510.600(c) of this chapter

Indications for use.Indications for use: Turkeys: For prevention of coccidiosis
Turkeys: For prevention of coccidiosis

Conditions of Use.Conditions of Use:: (d) (4) Pheasants. It is used as follows:

Indications for use.Indications for use: Growing pheasants: For the prevention of coccidiosis caused by Eimeria colchici, E. duodenalis, and E. phasiani
Growing pheasants: For the prevention of coccidiosis caused by Eimeria colchici, E. duodenalis, and E. phasiani

Limitations.Limitations: Feed continuously as sole ration. Use as sole source of amprolium

Indications for use.Indications for use: Growing pheasants: For the prevention of coccidiosis caused by Eimeria colchici, E. duodenalis, and E. phasiani

Limitations.Limitations: Feed continuously as sole ration. Use as sole source of amprolium

Specifications.Specifications:: (a) Specifications. Type A medicated articles containing:(1) 25 percent amprolium and 8 percent ethopabate or 5 percent amprolium and 1.6 percent ethopabate;(2) 25 percent amprolium and 0.8 percent ethopabate or 5 percent amprolium and 0.16 percent ethopabate.

Approvals.Approvals:: (b) Approvals. See No. 016592 in § 510.600(c) of this chapter.

Special Considerations.Special Considerations:: (c) Special considerations. Do not use in Type B or Type C medicated feeds containing bentonite.

Related Tolerances.Related Tolerances:: (d) Related tolerances. See §§ 556.50 and 556.260 of this chapter.

Conditions of Use.Conditions of Use:: (e) Conditions of use. It is used in chicken feed as follows:

Indications for use.Indications for use: Broiler chickens: As an aid in the prevention of coccidiosis
Broiler chickens: As an aid in the prevention of coccidiosis

Limitations.Limitations: Feed continuously as sole ration; as sole source of amprolium. Not for laying chickens

Indications for use.Indications for use: Broiler chickens: As an aid in the prevention of coccidiosis

Limitations.Limitations: Feed continuously as sole ration; as sole source of amprolium. Not for laying chickens

Indications for use.Indications for use: Broiler chickens and replacement chickens: where immunity to coccidiosis is not desired: As an aid in the prevention of coccidiosis where severe exposure to coccidiosis from Eimeria acervulina, E. maxima, and E. brunetti is likely to occur

Broiler chickens and replacement chickens: where immunity to coccidiosis is not desired: As an aid in the prevention of coccidiosis where severe exposure to coccidiosis from Eimeria acervulina, E. maxima, and E. brunetti is likely to occur

Limitations.Limitations: Feed continuously as sole ration; as sole source of amprolium. Not for chickens over 16 weeks of age

Indications for use.Indications for use: Broiler chickens and replacement chickens: where immunity to coccidiosis is not desired: As an aid in the prevention of coccidiosis where severe exposure to coccidiosis from Eimeria acervulina, E. maxima, and E. brunetti is likely to occur

Limitations.Limitations: Feed continuously as sole ration; as sole source of amprolium. Not for chickens over 16 weeks of age

Indications for use.Indications for use: 1. Broiler chickens and replacement chickens: where immunity to coccidiosis is not desired; to aid in prevention of coccidiosis where severe exposure to coccidiosis from Eimeria acervulina, E. maxima, and E. brunetti is likely to occur; for increased rate of weight gain in broiler chickens raised in floor pens

Limitations.Limitations: Feed as the sole ration from the time chickens are placed on litter until past the time when coccidiosis is ordinarily a hazard. Not for chickens over 16 weeks of age; do not feed to laying chickens; as sole source of amprolium; not for use as a treatment for outbreaks of coccidiosis. Bacitracin as bacitracin methylenedisalicylate as provided by No. 054771 in § 510.600(c) of this chapter

Indications for use.Indications for use: 2. Broiler chickens: As an aid in prevention of coccidiosis where severe exposure to coccidiosis from Eimeria acervulina, E. maxima, and E. brunetti is likely to occur; for improved feed efficiency

Limitations.Limitations: Feed as the sole ration from the time chickens are placed on litter until market weight. Not for chickens over 16 weeks of age; do not feed to laying chickens; as sole source of amprolium; not for use as a treatment for coccidiosis. Bacitracin zinc as provided by No. 054771 in § 510.600(c) of this chapter

Indications for use.Indications for use: Broiler chickens: As an aid in the prevention of coccidiosis where severe exposure to coccidiosis from Eimeria acervulina, E. maxima, and E. brunetti is likely to occur; for increased rate of weight gain, improved feed efficiency

Limitations.Limitations: Feed continuously as the sole ration; as sole source of amproliumBambermycins as provided by No. 016592 in § 510.600(c) of this chapter

Indications for use.Indications for use: For broiler chickens and replacement chickens where immunity to coccidiosis is not desired; prevention of coccidiosis
For broiler chickens and replacement chickens where immunity to coccidiosis is not desired; prevention of coccidiosis

Limitations.Limitations: Not for laying chickens

Indications for use.Indications for use: For broiler chickens and replacement chickens where immunity to coccidiosis is not desired; prevention of coccidiosis

Limitations.Limitations: Not for laying chickens

May be used in combination with.May be used in combination with:: (f) Amprolium and ethopabate may also be used in combination with:(1)-(2) [Reserved](3) Chlortetracycline as in § 558.128.(4) Lincomycin as in § 558.325.(5) Virginiamycin as in § 558.635.
